üö® 2025 was supposed to make you rich. It didn‚Äôt.

BTC hit ATHs while most portfolios bled.

Read the thread to understand what actually broke this cycle. üëáüßµ 
/1 ü´† Exhale, frens. 2025 is over.

On paper it was historic: BTC hit $126K, the US launched a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve, BlackRock paid dividends on-chain.

But did it feel like a win? For many ‚Äî no.
/2 üìâ Despite BTC ATHs, the year felt strangely dull.

We waited for a wild altseason ‚Äî instead we learned a hard truth:

Institutional adoption doesn‚Äôt care about your old bags. They play by their own rules.
/3 ü§ñ The AI revolution? Overhyped.

Yes, there were sparks: Virtuals, GOAT (an AI-created token), AI-run memecoins.

But no wildfire. Just short-lived pumps followed by brutal cooldowns.
/4 ‚öôÔ∏è Tech kept improving ‚Äî markets stopped caring.

Ethereum shipped Pectra & account abstraction.

Solana tested 1M TPS with Firedancer.

Monad pushed parallel EVM to 10k TPS.

Result? Shrugs. Speed alone no longer sells.
/5 üß† The market matured ‚Äî fast.

‚ÄúLower fees‚Äù and ‚Äúhigher TPS‚Äù used to mean easy multiples.

In 2025, tech for tech‚Äôs sake stopped printing money. Narratives > benchmarks.
/6 üíî Altcoin pain was real.

Veterans waited for rewards. Newcomers chased ‚Äúeasy x‚Äôs.‚Äù

Instead, capital flowed into BTC ETFs, RWA (BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL), and stablecoin infra. No mercy.
/7 üé≠ Retail chose memes.

Institutions chose infrastructure.

There was no middle ground.

Complex protocols were ignored while memecoins absorbed attention and liquidity.
/8 üõ°Ô∏è Security illusions collapsed.

Bybit lost $1.5B to Lazarus Group.

Trust Wallet extension attacks reminded us: non-custodial ‚â† invincible.
Even giants bleed.
/9 üïµÔ∏è That‚Äôs why Q4 saw a shift.

Smart money rotated toward privacy.

ZEC quietly outperformed as anonymity became more valuable than hype in a world of total on-chain transparency.
/10 üìå No ‚Äúto the moon‚Äù talk today.

2025 taught us one thing: adaptability beats belief.

Be flexible. Hedge risks. Stay open to weird narratives (yes, AI memes).

The market owes you nothing.

A local top can happen in February just as it can happen in March. Right after the local top we predict a correction or retrace since we are expecting strong marketwide bearish action sometime around mid-2026, then we can expect additional growth after the first resistance is met. That's what you see depicted on the chart.

Solana is one of the best projects and notice how the biggest volume bar on this chart is green and appeared around late July 2025.

Since the start of the consolidation pattern SOLUSDT produced two major bullish waves, both lasted exactly 161 days or 23 bars/weeks.

The bearish cycle for Solana ended last week. If we project 161 days into the future we get Monday 25 May 2026. This would be the week of the next peak if the wave-duration is repeated. So, there you have it.

The waves on the chart are for illustrations purposes only. The next rise can be gradual just as it can be parabolic. Only the market knows. What we know with 100% certainty is the fact that Solana is trading green and set to grow. Full 10X trade-numbers.

üî• LATEST: The $SOL ETFs saw another week full of net inflows.

$SOLüü£ ‚Äî New Year, New Screens. Derivatives got louder. ‚òïüìà
TL;DR üìå
SOL pushed from ~$127 ‚Üí $132.21, tagged $133.29, and printed the first meaningful pullback candle after a clean ramp. Derivatives confirm real participation: OI ~9.7M‚Äì9.8M, funding 0.0057%, $31.5K longs / $22.2K shorts liquidated. This isn‚Äôt a cycle-counting story ‚Äî it‚Äôs a positioning story. üéõÔ∏è
üü£ Price action (spot + structure)
SOL trades at $132.21 (+3.77%), with a 24H range $126.76 ‚Üí $133.29 and $2.88B 24H volume. That‚Äôs follow-through, not a headline candle. A first red bar after tagging highs is normal ‚Äî markets breathe. ‚úÖ
üìä Derivatives snapshot (where pressure builds)
Open Interest ~9.7M‚Äì9.8M, up from the prior ~9.1M‚Äì9.2M zone ‚Üí more leverage is now active. Funding at 0.0057% stays mild (no overcrowding alarm). Liquidations: $31.5K longs vs $22.2K shorts ‚Äî small, but clearly two-sided. This move isn‚Äôt carried by spot alone. üßæ
üß† Why these numbers matter
Spot can drift. Leverage forces decisions. Rising OI means tighter liquidation ranges. Funding shows who‚Äôs paying to stay biased. Liquidations show who actually got removed from the trade. That‚Äôs the modern ‚Äúbusiness cycle‚Äù ‚Äî not counting days and whispering ‚Äúfour years‚Äù like a ritual. üïØÔ∏èüòÑ
‚òï The New Year phone call (clear version)
‚ÄúHello, this is the exchange. Your leverage is active.‚Äù
First, it taps overconfident longs ($31.5K). Then it taps shorts ($22.2K) with: ‚ÄúRelax ‚Äî your turn is scheduled.‚Äù Same market, different invoice. üìûüòè
üß± Order book micro-read
Around $132.2, bids stack down to ~$132.08, asks up to ~$132.37. Enough depth to pause and normalize, not enough to declare a moon landing. If price ranges here 1‚Äì2 days, this level often becomes the new ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù üß©
‚úÖ Bottom line
SOL‚Äôs push is backed by rising OI + controlled funding + two-sided liquidations. That‚Äôs healthier than a pure hype pump. After $133.29, a red candle isn‚Äôt bearish ‚Äî it‚Äôs the chart taking a sip of water. ‚òïüìâ‚û°Ô∏èüìà
